image.altText: A photo of Keith Kerinauia being escorted by a prison security guard at the BWS Airport Tavern bottleshop.

props.synopsis: A jury has found Keith Kerinauia guilty of the murder of Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty, following an eight-day trial in the NT Supreme Court.

title.children: Keith Kerinauia found guilty of murdering Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty

image.altText: Natalie Frahm, the woman killed by an alleged shooter in South Mackay.

props.synopsis: Police allege a man shot and killed 34-year-old Natalie Frahm while she was sitting in her car outside a Robb Place residence in South Mackay about 4:30pm on Wednesday.

title.children: Woman randomly shot dead in Mackay in front of children described as 'absolute treasure'

image.altText: an offshore jack-up drill rig.

props.synopsis: NT government-owned utility the Power and Water Corporation has revealed the territory's shortfall in gas supply cost taxpayers $43.4 million in 2023-24, and is estimated to cost another $24.3 million next financial year.

title.children: Emergency gas deals to cost NT taxpayers almost $70m over two years, utility reveals

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: Gas prices return to crisis highs as cold weather, a lack of renewable energy and plant outages smash the east coast market.

title.children: Gas threat 'immediate' as cold spell, renewable lulls and outages squeeze supply

image.altText: ndia header

props.synopsis: A Labor MP suggests NDIA officials could have been "inappropriately cultivated" by a US software firm that holds a lucrative contract.

title.children: US software firm took NDIA officials to fine-dining restaurants and golf days. The gifts weren’t declared

image.altText: A fire engine arrives to put out a mound of rubbish that caught fire.

props.synopsis: As state ministers get set to meet with the Minister for Environment, 7.30 can reveal the high number of fires caused by lithium-ion batteries.

title.children: 'Matter of urgency': As lithium-ion batteries explode, waste chiefs say change is necessary

image.altText: A pyramid shaped building with three flags out the front at half mast.

props.synopsis: All elected members of the Barkly Regional Council have been officially dismissed following an investigation into its management, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Entire NT outback council dismissed after investigation finds 'serious deficiencies'

image.altText: A CCTV grainy photo of a white utility on a road.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old pedestrian dies after an alleged road rage incident in Western Sydney as police search for the driver of a ute they say hit the man before fleeing the scene.

title.children: Police search for ute driver over alleged fatal road rage attack in Western Sydney

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor during a press conference.

props.synopsis: It wasn't that long ago that Peter Dutton and his merry band in the Coalition had a simple message for voters: "If you don't know, vote no." It's a different story now as he asks voters to trust him to deliver a nuclear age.

title.children: The party of 'don't know, vote no' has had a change of heart when it comes to the nuclear age

image.altText: Two men are standing next to each other and each holding one hand up. The flags of Russia and Vietnam are behind them.

props.synopsis: The United States has strongly criticised Vietnam's decision to host Vladimir Putin. The Russian President is looking to Asian countries for support as he has been largely isolated from the West.

title.children: Russia and Vietnam sign new agreements, day after Putin's North Korea visit

image.altText: A mugshot of a man

props.synopsis: Travis Scott, whose real name is Jacques Bermon Webster II, was arrested on charges of trespassing and disorderly intoxication in Miami, according to jail records.

title.children: Rapper Travis Scott arrested for alleged trespassing and disorderly intoxication

image.altText: Close up of a beluga whale grey in colour

props.synopsis: Two beluga whales faced a gruelling journey across Ukraine's war-ravaged region of Kharkiv to reach their new home in Spain.

title.children: Beluga whales saved from bombing in Ukraine in 'the most complex marine mammal rescue ever'

image.altText: A mans face close up and a women holds a poster with the faces of all those killed in a place crash

props.synopsis: The families of victims who were killed in two separate Boeing 737 MAX plane crashes are seeking a criminal prosecution and a fine of $US24.78 billion ($37.1 billion) against the aerospace company.

title.children: 'Deadliest corporate crime in US history': Families of victims killed in Boeing 737 MAX crashes seek $37 billion fine

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: ACMA claims Optus should have known about a flaw in its system four years before the cyber attack that stole millions of Australians' data, but failed to fix it.

title.children: Optus cyber attack could have been prevented four years prior, ACMA says

image.altText: a surfer leaning into a wave

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Australian National University have found the nation's surf breaks are worth a fortune to the economy as well as wave riders' wellbeing — and should be better protected as a result.

title.children: What's a wave worth? Study finds surfing churns almost $3bn into the Australian economy each year

image.altText: shows green Woolworths illuminated  sign at the entrance to the store

props.synopsis: Store workers at supermarket giant Woolworths have voted in favour of a new pay and entitlements package, after a union campaign plagued by allegations of "misinformation" and "bad faith bargaining".

title.children: 'We got breadcrumbs': One of Australia's biggest unions accused of pushing a bad deal for Woolworths workers

image.altText: A black shopping basket sitting on a kitchen bench that contains bread, mince, carrots, apples and milk.

props.synopsis: Basic grocery items are 25 per cent cheaper at Aldi when compared with Coles and Woolworths, a new report from Choice has found.

title.children: Aldi stores 25pc cheaper than Coles, Woolworths, Choice report finds

image.altText: Three men sit on the back of a ute tray in a concrete warehouse raising wine glasses with red wine and smiling

props.synopsis: At the prestigious Decanter wine awards in London, Australian has "retained its status amongst the major global players" after recording a series of impressive medals.

title.children: Small Australian wineries record 'mind-blowing' wins at Decanter awards in London

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: Judges only have authority over waterways, Queen Elizabeth committed treason and Tasmania Police is a company just like Bunnings and McDonald's, a jury hears.

title.children: Accused man likens police to McDonald's, Bunnings, at Tasmanian trial

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A former husband and wife who ran a regional South Australian bakery and preyed upon underage staff have been jailed for their "vile crimes" and the "irreparable" long-term trauma inflicted on the victims.

title.children: 'Monsters' who sexually abused underage employees at regional bakery jailed for 'vile crimes'

image.altText: A classic building that houses the NSW District Court

props.synopsis: Three men have been charged over the alleged gang-rape of three women during a bucks weekend in Newcastle in February, 2022.

title.children: Woman tells court 'swarm of people' grabbed her before alleged gang-rape during bucks party

image.altText: An elderly woman wearing glasses and an apron smiles in front of a kitchen bench covered with food

props.synopsis: At 101 years of age, Mary Norris' secret to health and longevity isn't a special diet — but it does take place in the kitchen.

title.children: Mary's not-so-secret side hustle to health and happiness at 101

image.altText: A baby moose head pokes up from between a float plane and dock on a lake.

props.synopsis: An Alaskan man and two police officers rescued a baby moose from a "sure demise" after the animal became stuck between a lake float plane and dock.

title.children: 'He just kept slipping and slipping': Police save baby moose at Alaskan lake

image.altText: close up of hand holding a menstrual cup

props.synopsis: Some people who menstruate are interested in making the switch to menstrual cups or discs, but say they don't know enough about reusable period products to confidently do so.

title.children: Curious about menstrual cups? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of waves at a beach.

props.synopsis: Australian mini-series Exposure explores the "total rage and desperation" of a sexual assault survivor, inspired by true events.

title.children: Why making a mystery thriller series inspired by her real-life assault changed Lucy Coleman 'to her core'

image.altText: A composite image of Lance Franklin (left) and Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow.

props.synopsis: When Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow runs out on the MCG for Queensland in State of Origin II, he will be emulating his childhood "idol" Lance Franklin.

title.children: How AFL legend Lance Franklin inspired Maroons State of Origin star

image.altText: Children standing in front of  Uyghur village.

props.synopsis: Authorities in China's western Xinjiang region are systematically replacing the names of villages inhabited by Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities to reflect the ruling Communist Party's ideology, a report released by Human Rights Watch says.

title.children: China changes hundreds of village names 'to erase Uyghur culture', HRW report says

image.altText: A man wearing military garb with weapons pointing at a piece of paper on the wall.

props.synopsis: In an interview on Israeli TV Daniel Hagari said the idea of destroying Hamas is throwing sand in people's eyes, drawing criticism from the prime minister's office and a military clarification.

title.children: Israel's chief army spokesman says Hamas cannot be eliminated in apparent growing rift with political leadership

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: In the wake of tensions between the federal and Tasmanian governments over the redevelopment of the RSV Nuyina's base in Hobart, WA says it's open to discussions about the future of the Australian Antarctic Program.

title.children: Hobart is Antarctic icebreaker Nuyina's home port — but a funding stoush has put WA on the radar

image.altText: A screenshot of bodycam footage released of police questioning Baldwin on set of Rust.

props.synopsis: The evidence, which includes images and video from crew and a set photographer, shows Mr Baldwin pointed his gun at a crew member and fired a blank round, held his finger on the trigger when not supposed to and engaged in horseplay with the weapon.

title.children: New evidence in Alec Baldwin Rust trial shows he pointed gun at crew members before fatal shooting

image.altText: Lachlan Morganti outside court on June 20, 2024

props.synopsis: Lachlan Morganti, 22, is charged with stealing more than $60,000 from an online fundraiser for allegedly murdered Victorian woman Hannah McGuire's grieving family.

title.children: Man accused of stealing from allegedly murdered woman's fundraiser faces court

image.altText: Brunette woman, wearing a black t-shirt, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Police allege Daniel Billings sexually assaulted and intimidated the 28-year-old childcare worker over a series of months before murdering her in April.

title.children: Man accused of murdering Molly Ticehurst appears in court

image.altText: A hillside neighbourhood of grey brick homes with haze in the distance.

props.synopsis: The South American country experienced a national outage for several hours after a single transmission line malfunctioned.

title.children: Electricity turned back on as Ecuador emerges from national outage

image.altText: A group of soldiers can be seen around an excavator working in a field

props.synopsis: Overgrown trees and shrubbery appear to be the cause behind 30 North Korean soldiers crossing the demarcation line separating the two countries, who are still technically at war.

title.children: What led to warning shots at the North Korean border?
